participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

fes_youth_q10.Description: Family members really help and support one another. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q1.Description: We fight a lot in our family. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q11.Description: We often seem to be killing time at home. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q2.Description: Family members rarely become openly angry. | 0 = True; 1 = False

fes_youth_q12.Description: We put a lot of energy into what we do at home. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q3.Description: Family members sometimes get so angry they throw things. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q13.Description: There is a feeling of togetherness in our family. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q4.Description: Family members hardly ever lose their tempers. | 0 = True; 1 = False

fes_youth_q14.Description: We rarely volunteer when something has to be done at home. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q5.Description: Family members often criticize each other. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q15.Description: Family members really back each other up. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q6.Description: Family members sometimes hit each other. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q16.Description: There is very little group spirit in our family. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q7.Description: If there's a disagreement in our family, we try hard to smooth things over and keep the peace. | 0 = True; 1 = False

fes_youth_q17.Description: We really get along well with each other. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q8.Description: Family members often try to one-up or outdo each other. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q18.Description: There is plenty of time and attention for everyone in our family. | 1 = True; 0 = False

fes_youth_q9.Description: In our family, we believe you don't ever get anywhere by raising your voice. | 0 = True; 1 = False

fes_y_ss_fc.Description: Conflict Subscale from the Family Environment Scale Sum of Youth Report (RAW Score): fes_youth_q1 + fes_youth_q2 + fes_youth_q3 + fes_youth_q4 + fes_youth_q5 + fes_youth_q6 + fes_youth_q7 + fes_youth_q8 + fes_youth_q9; Validation: Minimum of five items answered | Note that the scores for items that are reversed scored already reflect this scoring (fes_youth_q1, fes_youth_q4, fes_youth_q7, fes_youth_q9). Moos, R. H., and  Moos, B. S. (1994)  Family Environment Scale manual (3rd ed.). Palo Alto, CA: Consulting Psychologists Press.

fes_y_ss_fc_nm.Description: Conflict Subscale from the Family Environment Scale, Sum of Youth Report: Number Missing Answers

fes_y_ss_fc_nt.Description: Conflict Subscale from the Family Environment Scale, Sum of Youth Report: Number Total Questions

fes_y_ss_fc_na.Description: Conflict Subscale from the Family Environment Scale, Sum of Youth Report: Number Answered

fes_y_ss_fc_pr.Description: Conflict Subscale from the Family Environment Scale, Sum of Youth Report: Prorated Score (Based on minimum of five items answered): [fes_y_ss_fc]*[fes_y_ss_fc_nt] /[fes_y_ss_fc_na]
